page.title: 11Mining in the Girvan Valley
page.content: Coal mining has been practised in the Girvan valley since the 17 Century. The coal seams to be close to the surface around New Dalliy which was built primarily to house the local miners, although there is also NCB terraced housing in Girvan. Both coal and fireclay were mined in the main pits of Dalquharran, Romilly and Maxwell. The miners came from as far as Ayr and their heyday these pits employed over 450 mimers. By the 1950's the coal seams were becoming to difficult to work and they closed down one after the other, with the last Dalquharran closing in 1977. However the NCB has intimated that open cast mining may be possible in the forseeable future to extract the coal left near the surface.
